page.title: 14LIFE IN WINSTON TODAY.
page.content: The essential conservatism of rural dwellers is reflected in the village of Winston today. Significantly, the th8ngs that attract Winston to its inhabitants are the surrounding countryside, the tranquillity of the village and the friendly atmosphere generated by a caring and hard-working community. this spirit is no better exemplified than by the village hall, constructed in 1956 by the men of the village working without pay. The cost of the materials was raused by holding concerts. Concerts, discos, badminton and the Womens' Institute all benefit from the building. This attitude of community improvement is now shown in the Winston Playing Fields Association, which has provided a large play area for the village children with climbing frames and tennis courts.
